summary: This document is an email chain from November 10, 2020, forwarding a letter concerning a potential victim of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The letter originated from a law firm and was routed through the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS), with discussions about whether the individual is a statutory victim and if the FBI should be involved.

persons.name: Jennifer Freeman
persons.role: Attorney at Marsh Law Firm PLLC
persons.context: Sender of the original email forwarding a letter about a potential Epstein/Maxwell victim. She is identified as working for Marsh Law Firm PLLC.

persons.name: Joyanna Silbe
persons.context: Copied on the initial email from Jennifer Freeman regarding the annexed victim letter.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as an alleged perpetrator of abuse against the potential victim mentioned in the forwarded letter.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named alongside Epstein as an alleged perpetrator of abuse against the potential victim mentioned in the forwarded letter.

connections.description: Both are named together as alleged perpetrators of abuse against a potential victim in the forwarded letter.
Jennifer Freeman, as an attorney, is forwarding a letter concerning a potential victim of Epstein, indicating a legal/professional connection to the case.
Jennifer Freeman, as an attorney, is forwarding a letter concerning a potential victim of Maxwell, indicating a legal/professional connection to the case.

events.title: Forwarding of Epstein Victim Letter
events.description: An email chain forwards a letter from a law firm concerning a potential victim of Epstein and Maxwell, with internal discussion about its handling by the U.S. Attorney's Office and potential referral to the FBI.

events.title: Prior Counsel Advice on Victim Interview
events.description: A note in the email states that the potential victim's counsel advised a year prior (approx. 2019) that she was not in a position to be interviewed at that time.

keyFacts: A letter from a law firm (Marsh Law Firm PLLC) concerning a potential victim of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell was forwarded to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York on November 10, 2020.
Internal email discussion indicates the victim's counsel had previously advised (around 2019) that she was not in a position to be interviewed, but the matter was still referred to the FBI.

The correspondence highlights procedural handling of potential victim reports, noting that 'civilian crime reports' (CCR) would not act if the individual is a statutory victim of a charged case, and would instead forward it.
The document contains multiple redactions of sender/recipient names and email addresses within the U.S. Attorney's Office.
